I got this a few weeks ago and installed 7 Ultimate on my laptop. Everything has worked great, except that I can neither find the sidebar to turn it on, nor can I locate anything relating to the sidebar or gadgets anywhere on this system.

This could somehow be my fault, because the first thing I did when installation of the OS was complete was to turn off many of the features and graphic enhancements that I did not use often to boost my laptop's performance. I had also turned the UAC settings all the way down to enable more customization.

 I have been up all night trying to figure this out. Since then I have turned the UAC all the way back up, as I was informed that this could be preventing me from enabling the sidebar. From that point, I was informed to follow Start>Programs>Accessories>Windows Sidebar, and open it from that location. 

However, there is no 'Windows Sidebar' folder there. There's no sidebar folder/files/information anywhere on here, and searches return no results.

Have I somehow deleted this information? Or was the Windows Sidebar not implemented in this version of the OS, or more specifically, this package? I believe I turned of the necessary settings for the sidebar, but I don't understand how I could have deleted it. I expect this to somehow be my error, I just lack the knowledge to confirm it.


Thank you, again, thethingy, for all of this software. It's a very empowering feeling, to wield such tools without fiscal boundaries.
